<DOMAIN>PUBLIC-RELATIONS</DOMAIN>
<RESUME_START>
HUMAN RESOURCES SUPERVISOR

SUMMARY

I am a human resources & business administrator with over 10 years of progressive experience; augmented by a strong post-graduate background in human resources, conflict resolution, and international relations.
I have experience in HR policy and organizational design, job analysis, employee management, recruitment/selection process, benefits/compensation, contract negotiations, performance management, training/development, and strategic planning.
I have a sound knowledge of labor relations, occupational health & safety, pay equity and other related labor laws locally and internationally.
I've proven ability to implement successful human resources management strategies to support corporate mandate.
Functional Expertise Strategic planning Learning & development Policies & procedures Performance reviews Recruitment/selection process Employee welfare Talent management Organization leadership Risk management

SKILLS

Microsoft Office: Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Data Track Time and Attendance Software; Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) Software

EXPERIENCE


08/2011 to 08/2015
Human Resources Supervisor
Company Name
— City , State
Developed job profiles and source candidates from major job boards; select, interview, and recruit for positions Administered employee benefit plans to ensure compliance with FLSA and other applicable statutes/regulations Handled employee terminations, grievance, and other difficult situations in a sensitive, fair, and respectful manner, working closely with legal counsel, supervisors and management.
Coached managers on the process of evaluating employees, setting goals, conducting objective performance reviews, and recognizing and awarding performance to improve productivity Planned and developed on-the-job training programs for line employees and career development programs for managers with a focus on retaining existing talent and reducing employee turnover Identified talent and aspirations of individual employees and provided coaching aimed at motivating them to advance their careers within the company Established and maintained proper structures and processes to track time and attendance, vacations, and other activities resulting in efficiency gains of 35% Implemented Payroll and HR policies (reduce overtime rate) resulting in annual cost savings of 100,000.

10/2009 to 05/2011
Assistant Manager
Company Name
Established an open channel of communication, enabling employees quick and easy access to information such as benefits, training and development, and opportunities for career advancement Designed and implemented a holistic HR strategy to meet short term & long-term business challenges with focus on the following key areas such as talent & leadership, culture & values, engagement & connect, supervisory capability, productivity & cost Created a training program to develop employees to meet both core and job competency gaps Worked directly with the HR manager to redesign the company's compensation and benefits. Prepared PowerPoint presentations, created Excel spreadsheet reports, gathered/distributed confidential reports Executed comprehensive learning calendar to meet individual / organizational needs; ensured use of
standards, processes and tools developed by the Global learning organization.

12/2006 to 05/2009
Field Researcher
Company Name
Travels to field sites to collect and record data and/or samples as appropriate to the specific objectives of the study.
As appropriate to the specified position, codes and verifies data in accordance with specified research protocol and coding procedures, and enters data into a computer database and/or spreadsheet application for subsequent analysis.
Develops or assists in the development of interview schedules; contacts potential subjects to introduce and explain study objectives and protocol, and to arrange interviews, either in person or by telephone.
Identifies and compiles lists of potential research subjects in accordance with study objectives and parameters, as appropriate to the individual position.
Conducts and records face-to-face and/or telephone interviews with subjects, in accordance with predetermined interview protocol, data collection procedures, and documentation standards.
Reviews and edits data to ensure completeness and accuracy of information; follows up with subjects to resolve problems or clarify data collected.

07/2002 to 12/2005
Public Relations Officer
Company Name
Planned publicity strategies and campaigns Wrote and produced presentations and press releases Dealt with enquiries from the public, the press and related organizations Organized promotional events such as press conferences, open days, exhibitions, tours and visits Spoke publicly at interviews, press conferences, and presentations Provided clients with information about promotional opportunities and current PR campaigns Responsible for company relationship with other companies and government bureaus Assisted in developing and implementing the company's communication strategies.

SKILLS

<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior Account Executive, Public Relations

Location: Illinois, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Public Relations

Description:
Role Summary:The Senior Account Executive that has a focus on media relations will independently lead $100-299K in retainer accounts or projects. The Senior Account Executive will manage multiple responsibilities including generating consistent media exposure for clients, supporting the development of key themes, campaign strategy, client relations and mentoring other members of the team. Financial experience in public relations is a must have for success in this role.
Responsibilities:Media Relations:Identifies and secures an array of media placements including high-profile and feature opportunities for clients across the teamDelegates tasks and helps with mentoring Account Coordinators, Account Executives, and interns Assists in the development of strategic PR plans and campaign development for team accounts they supportDevelops and maintains relationships with all media outlets including trades, broadcast, and national mediaDevelops unique story angles and timely pitches to generate consistent client exposureClient Service:Independently leads $100-299K in client account revenueServe as lead point of contact and run calls for the client accounts they are leadingDraft PR plans for the accounts they are leadingFunctions as a general point of contact (for clients and internally) for PR initiativesSupports the lead point of contact for other team client accountsParticipates in regular client update calls and meetings as well as new client discovery meetings for other team client accountsWriting:Reviews and edits company-generated content before sharing with clientsSupports in drafting press releases, award nominations, social media posts, and other client-related materials, when neededAdministrative Support:Assists internal team members with other clients, business development, and Company projectsReviews press reports before sending to clientsEnsures that the team has saved final versions to SharePoint and has scheduled press releases for distributionCompany Ambassador:Acts as a steward of the JConnelly brand, consistently representing and reflecting the Company’s core values, approach, and high standards of excellence in all client, media, and public interactions
Performs other duties as assigned
Education: College degree; or equivalent related business experience
Experience & Expertise:Minimum 3-5 years of successful industry-related experience with an emphasis on managing client relationshipsDemonstrated ability to organize/prioritize work, handle details accurately, follow up with minimum supervision, and complete tasks within specified deadlinesExcellent interpersonal, communication, problem-solving, and customer service skillsProficiency with various software applications including the full Office suite, as well as social media channelsProficiency in PR related software including but not limited to Cision, Meltwater, TrendKite, Sprout, Hootsuite, etc.Experience in financial aspects of public relations is required for this role.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
